Nice! I like the idea. So, no need to reload or re-render. Sorry but, I'm still learning about webcomponents and litelement.
I think I've set all the blank lines and spaces as you like. Anyway, if anything else is needed, just say it.
Thanks for your help.

The dispatchEvent part is to reset the table cell style arround the checkbox.
We also can do this calling this.attachHandlers() or just:
$('.permissions-table input:checkbox').change();
But I don't like the idea to mix vanilla javascript with jquery (at least inside the same fragment/method)
blank line here please, it makes js easier to read, imo, if you leave a blank line at the start of any multi line function body, even lambdas.

You don't need a blank like on if blocks, just function bodies. Sorry for not being clear :(
I know I am being a bit pedantic here - I just think this approach makes the js more readable later. Adding blanks before every block would be a bit too much whitespace though. So, a compromise.

Can't you just use "new Event("change", { bubbles: true })" for these lines? Maybe you don't even need to bubble it.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/Events/Creating_and_triggering_events
Yes. You are right. I'm still attached to the old ways...
I'd get rid of this test. Only really old crappy browsers don't have this. Up to you though.
